item.title: Read viz attributes from GEXF files
item.description: So one of the new features that I’ve working on is processing viz attributes. item.title: Reboot of rgexf
item.description: The rgexf R package has been around a couple of years now, but without much going on on CRAN (my bad!). In this post I’ll show how to use the new version (on development and soon the be shipped to CRAN) together with the netdiffuseR R package to visualize a random diffusion process. First, we load all the packages that we will be using # Loading the relevant packages library(igraph, quietly = TRUE) library(rgexf, quietly = TRUE) library(netdiffuseR, quietly = TRUE) Next, we simulate a random diffusion network, in this case, a small-world network with 200 nodes spanning 20 time periods.

item.title: netdiffuseR: Analysis of Diffusion and Contagion Processes on Networks
item.description: Empirical statistical analysis, visualization and simulation of diffusion and contagion processes on networks. The package implements algorithms for calculating network diffusion statistics such as transmission rate, hazard rates, exposure models, network threshold levels, infectiousness (contagion), and susceptibility. The package is inspired by work published in Valente, et al., (2015) DOI:10.1016/j.socscimed.2015.10.001; Valente (1995) ISBN:9781881303213, Myers (2000) DOI:10.1086⁄303110, Iyengar and others (2011) DOI:10.1287/mksc.1100.0566, Burt (1987) DOI:10.1086⁄228667; among others.
